headline: Beet Salad with Goat Cheese
description: This colorful beet salad with goat cheese, crunchy candied walnuts, baby greens, and balsamic dressing is perfect for a spectacular fall or winter main dish.

video.description: This substantial, 5-star salad features a sweet and tangy balsamic dressing.
video.name: Beet Salad with Goat Cheese

name: Beet Salad with Goat Cheese
recipeIngredient: 4 medium beets - scrubbed, trimmed and cut in half
1 (10 ounce) package mixed baby salad greens

recipeInstructions.text: Place beets into a saucepan, and fill with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, then cook for 20 to 30 minutes, until tender. Drain and cool, then cut in to cubes.

While the beets are cooking, place the walnuts in a skillet over medium-low heat. Heat until warm and starting to toast, then stir in the maple syrup. Cook and stir until evenly coated, then remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
In a small bowl, whisk together the orange juice concentrate, balsamic vinegar and olive oil to make the dressing.

Place a large helping of baby greens onto each of four salad plates, divide candied walnuts equally and sprinkle over the greens. Place equal amounts of beets over the greens, and top with pieces of goat cheese. Drizzle each plate with some of the dressing.

review.reviewBody: This felt like a lot of work for just a salad. I like all the ingredients, but putting them together just didn't work for me. I made it for two of us thinking leftovers are good. I would "candy" my walnuts a different way. Not sure I liked the taste of the dressing. Disappointed.
Great fresh salad. The goat cheese and beets were a great paring with the citrus derssing.

Great recipe! I made this for lunch today. Apart from the nutrition benefits mentioned in the video, beets also contain nitrates that help keep the blood vessels flexible so the blood keeps flowing...
I like the versatility of this recipe. I was able to substitute a different cheese, with good results. A great way to use fresh beets!

This is a delicious salad, fresh, crisp and colorful. I used Costco’s precooked beets and threw in several blueberries for added color. The dressing was a perfect accompaniment for the greens. Will definitely keep this one.
SO good! My mom always requests this salad when we do family pitch-ins!
Wonderful recipe. Love the maple coated walnuts added to the salad.
Fantastic instructions on how to cook beets. Thanks!

Excellent! I added some red onion. For the walnuts, I cooked as directed then immediately spread them out on parchment paper (keeping the pieces from touching) and let them cool and harden. Then put them in the refrigerator. No clumping...no stickiness.

I added a diced apple and adjusted the dressing a little to use orange juice instead of concentrate, adding a splash of maple syrup and salt & pepper to my taste. Really, REALLY, delicious salad! I used canned beets since fresh wasn't available this week at the grocery store. YUMM!
Dressing tastes like orange juice.

I really enjoyed this salad. I’m allergic to walnuts so I subbed pecans. My BF doesn’t care for goat cheese and is lactose intolerant so I made lactose free cheese and used that instead. This salad was fabulous. Great recipe

This recipe is fantastic! My family thought the dressing was too heavy on the vinegar, so I changed the recipe to 1 cup orange juice concentrate and kept the oil & vinegar quantities as shown. I also followed another reviewer’s suggestion and roasted the beets. I brought this salad to a celebration, and knowing everything heavy would fall to the bottom of the bowl, I deconstructed it and put the lettuce in a big bowl and arranged everything else, plus additional fruit, on a platter for guests to add to their individual salad.

This was wonderful! I added some ripe chopped pears in cubes and a touch of honey to the dressing. I also used a fresh orange and squeezed the juice rather than using frozen concentrate to make the dressing. It was delicious and got amazing reviews - even though we had a lot of dishes for dinner and my husband was afraid we would have a lot of extra food, the salad definitely wasn’t something we had to worry about! :)
Delish! I used feta, because I didn't have goat cheese. Thanks!!

I have just discovered how good beets are. This recipe was so good and I was full all night even though it was a salad. We didnt have mixed salad bag since it was the end of the week so we used the beet tops, a little kale, cucumbers and tomatoes. Followed the rest of recipe - it is delicious!
Great recipe!

This is amazing. The only changes I sometimes make are to use mixed spring greens and spinach, and, when I'm feeling lazy I use a premade balsamic dressing rather than make my own. Oh, and I usually roast the beets (a couple of hours in the oven, drizzled with a bit of olive oil, till easy to poke with a knife).
This was fantastic! I used regular orange juice & added chicken and it was delicious! I highly recommend this salad & I plan on adding it to my Thanksgiving menu this year!
Delicious. Makes it pleasurable to eat a salad. No complaints

It was great! I did not have any OJ concentrate so tried substituting with my grapefruit juice instead and it worked out just fine. I also happened to have Glazed Pecans from Orchard Valley Salad Toppers that I used and worked out fine as well. LOL, I also was out of goat cheese but had some Cambosola cheese to use up. It was still a hit! Happy to know how to make this awesome salad!
Hit of the dinner party, even hubby an ante beet person thought it was okay. I used creamy goat cheese which was a good choice for the cheese.
I use arugula for the greens. Great recipe - easy, healthy, and my 11 and 13 year old kids like it too.

This is an tasty recipe that is so close to a beet salad at a favorite restaurant. The walnuts were easy to caramelize and were nice and crunchy. I will definitely make this salad again. I have sent this to several friends.

I used del Monte sliced canned beets b/c produce dept were out of stock. This cut down on prep work. Very easy. I messed up on walnuts - didn't toast long enough so, maple syrup made it very sticky,clumpy. This salad was very tasty and I felt I was eatting a bit healthier! Loved it!
Delish! It was just what I need and the flavors I expected! I bought candied walnuts, and used arugula & spinach mix greens. I needed more goat cheese tho. Gonna make this all summer long!
No! I've now made it three times! Love this salad and so easy to make!

Awful recipe. Followed it to the letter... Edible but a waste of good goat cheese and walnuts.

Too much orange overpowers everything else. It tasted like a creamsicle with a hint of vinegar.

Boiling the beets for 30 minutes means you have to peel them manually with a peeler, since the skin doesn't come off easily. Notice the recipe doesn't mention how to get the skin off at all.
Loved it! The recipe was great and the salad was so delicious that I made a second batch the next day! Healthy, delicious and easy to make!
I didn’t have an orange or orange juice on hand, but used the juice from one mandarin and it resulted in a beets salad That was perfectly balanced, juicy and refreshing!
Really good. Like others, I used pecans and feta (I had on hand) and roasted the beets.

Easy and delicious. Did not have orange concentrate, so squeezed an orange into a measuring cup and added equal part of olive oil and balsamic vinegar to taste. Also ground a little sea salt into the dressing.
Delicious, loved the walnuts and the dressing, the beets were roasted in the oven and turned out perfect, served to guests and I will make it again.
Such a great salad. I made per the recipe and it was really amazing. The vinaigrette fits perfectly, is light and not overwhelming. I used fresh orange juice rather than the concentrate.

The main thing I did differently was to use, instead of the recipe's dressing, a cup of leftover homemade cranberry sauce diluted with orange juice. As did others, I substituted Feta cheese for the goat cheese and added a roughly diced unpeeled red apple. I folded in most of the wanuts but left some to sprinkle on top with the crumbled cheese. Makes a festive and tasty Christmas salad!

I love the proportions for the dressing. This is tasty and elegant. I roasted the beets whole and have also sliced them thick with a bit flavored oil (Orange is good.) That gives the beets a wonderful flavor, too. It also gives them more of a roasted texture.

This salad was delicious! I've had similar salads with cranberries instead of beets, but this was a nice change. What a fun way to incorporate beets into dinner. 

I sauteed the beets, but other than that followed the recipe as written. Served with Butternut Squash Bisque recipe from this site. Will definitely make again :-)
Love this salad . Made it for a group of coworkers and every one of them asked me for the recipe. Will make this over and over
used feta cheese instead of goat

very blah.
After having a very blah dinner with it, marinated the beets in the dressing overnight. Improved. However, still has very little zing to excite the taste buds.

I mostly followed this recipe but instead of orange juice concentrate, I just freshly squeezed the juice from one orange. I found that gave the salad dressing just enough flavor without being overwhelmingly citrusy.
I never heard of boiling unpeeled beets before, but it worked great. I'll never peel beets again!

A great beet recipe. I roasted the beets covered with foil for an hour. The beets weren’t done so I peeled and diced them and finished them in an oiled pan on the grill. This added nice flavor as well. I doubled the goat cheese and juiced and zested 2 oranges instead of the concentrate.
I wrapped the beets in tinfoil and baked at 400 degrees for 1 hour. Additionally, I swapped out the feta for goat cheese . Very yummy!!
Simply delicious. I made it exactly as written. When I plated it I added red onion. My 3 daughters and I all loved it.
Nice summer salad
Who knew candied walnuts could be this easy!?

I love beet salad and tried this one today. I used honey instead of maple syrup for the walnuts and only used virgin olive oil and balsamic drizzled over at the end. Really delicious -- OH I also had boiled a large beet and then pickled it a little in the fridge with olive oil and apple cider vinegar. All so good!
made this last night, we love it! For the dressing it called out to much Olive oil so I lessened it and sweetened it up with a little honey.

This was great. I added a healthy squirt of honey to dressing to calm the tang. Also added cherry tomatoes and cucumber because they needed to be used. Put in individual serving containers and met a friend for a picnic lunch. Perfect. Thank you for sharing!
Loved it just the way it was!!
This was easy and refreshing. I can beets so i just used my canned beets and the rest was easy.
loved it! added chicken & a little brown sugar to the dressing. delicious!
I loved this salad. You could add chicken and call it dinner. My husband said he hates beets but he eat the whole salad and didn’t complain.
Loved it!! I wasn’t sure if my husband would like the dressing, but he loved it. I will be making this a lot.

Excellent new family fav. I used two tablespoons of expresso balsamic vinegar as part of the required balsimic vinegar ingrediant. Boosted flavour of dressing. Could just drink the dressing it was so good
this is absolutely delicious. all the flavors together just taste so good. other than beets taking very long to boil and cook, this is a quick and easy recipe that we make several times a week!
I made this salad and added leftover grilled salmon to it, and it was delicious!
Great simple salad, I added a bit of salt and next time will add some tarragon to give it a French twist.
Yummy
This salad is now in my top 5 ever! Absolutely delish, easy and fun to make! Thank you Donna!

Excellent! I had mango nectar which I replaced for the OJ. It was PERFECT! I’ll make this again. My son loved the beets! After reading all of the positive effects of beets on our system I decided to try this. I’ve never made beets before so this was my first time. Thank you.
I used balsamic dressing and added pumpkin and sunflower seeds with dried cranberry. Great salad
I tend to be the type to modify recipes. This did not need it (although I only had pecans on hand). It is just spectacular. Perfect summer salad with beets from our CSA.

My new favorite beet salad!
I make beet salad often and change up the ingredients depending on what I have at home. 
 This recipe is utterly delicious! Using frozen orange juice concentrate adds a bright, sweet, yummy citrus edge & makes my mouth water just thinking about it! Topping the salad off with toasted maple syrup walnuts is ridiculously good and adds a brilliant sweet crunch to the tangy mix. This is my new GO-TO beet salad!!! DELIGHTFUL!

This was so delicious! I will certainly make it again. The dressing was also great with chicken and I'm considering trying it as a marinade. The creamy goat cheese, sweet, tangy dressing, roasted beets and crunchy nuts made for a really great bite.

Yummy! If in a rush it's fine to use store-bought balsamic dressing just don't use too much!
Great with chicken.
So good! Simple dressing was very tasty. Easy to make and contains super food beets. This will be a regular on my rotation.
Made exactly as recipe directed. Great flavor!
Loved this!! Easy to make! Bought some lovely beets from my local farmers market! Yummy!

This was delicious. Goat cheese is usually a little too overpowering for me, but combined with the beets and the walnuts, it's perfect and I found myself wanting to add more.

I took the advice of some of the other reviewers and roasted the beets wrapped in tin foil for about 1 1/2 hours. They came out perfect.

This was delicious. Goat cheese is usually a little too overpowering for me, but combined with the beets and the walnuts, it's perfect and I found myself wanting to add more.

I took the advice of some of the other reviewers and roasted the beets wrapped in tin foil for about 1 1/2 hours. They came out perfect.
I love beets and this is a very tasty salad. Love everything about it: sweet, crunchy, savory and sour rolled into one.
Very good!! I thought the walnuts were too chewy though and will probably just toast them next time. I also used frozen beets and roasted them.
Very good salad. I like beets and this is a good way to get those into your diet.
I would definitely make this again. It even tasted good the next day! Only changes - I roasted the beets, added maple syrup to the dressing and added a few blood oranges into the salad.
Still came out delicious. Had to omit the nuts and added craisins instead. Had this as a side salad, but can be as a meal.

I made this salad for very picky friends that came to my house for dinner and they loved it. And the pickiest one repeated and everything. I didn’t change a thing because I’m not a chef kind of person. Just instead of concentrated jui I used regular juice because I forgot to buy :))

Very good! Very easy! I made the walnuts the night before and just threw everything together in a few minutes the night of. I was a little worried about the OJ in the dressing, but it was delicious. We even put the dressing on the pork chops.
Delicious!

A great base recipe but a few minor tweaks I felt that made me lean towards a 4, a very strong 4 but.... :-)
I found the amount of dressing for the portions to be 2-3 times as much. I prefer roasting the beets (400ºF for ~45 minutes depending on the size of the beets) I like the tip of leaving a bit of the green stalks on when roasting so you have something to hold onto. I might try pickling the beets next time to get a different 'zing'. Thanks for the recipe.

We liked this a lot. My tweaks - Where I live, you can buy cooked whole beets in the produce section, so I just chopped 5 of them into chunky slices. I added a very tiny clove of crushed garlic to the dressing. I put a bit of the dressing on the beets to marinate for an hour or 2. Then I lightly dressed the greens (rocket/lettuce mix), put the beets on, then the walnuts, then the crumbled feta (goat cheese makes me ill). It was very pretty and tasty as well.
Delicious
Add sliced pears and it’s even better!
I substituted pecans for the walnuts. Followed the rest exactly. It was amazing!

I followed the recipe to a 't' except that I roasted the beets and marinated them overnight in balsamic. Perhaps this was the mistake. I love restaurant beet salad but didn't enjoy this. The beets had not flavour.

Roast the beets instead of boiling; scrub beets, trim ends, drizzle with olive oil, wrap in foil. Bake at 400 for one hour. Let rest until cool enough to handle. Using a paper towel, rub the skins off the beets. (This can be done ahead if time) I like to reheat the beets a bit and serve warm in the salad as it melts the goat cheese.
Definitely will make again...delicious!!
Easy to make, great taste and easy to modify if you like different cheeses. Yummy!
Easy, excellent and refreshing. No changes required. We loved it.

This was a great recipe and exactly what I was looking for. I used canned red beets instead of fresh and cut them, cut down on the time to serve and make. Also my fiancé doesn't like goat cheese and substituted feta cheese for him and I stayed with the goat cheese. Yum! Thank you!
Candied whole pecans with honey sugar and used honey goat cheese. For the dressing-puréed canned mandarin oranges ( didn’t have OJ concentrate ) and used lemon infused white balsamic. Delicious
Candied whole pecans with honey sugar and used honey goat cheese. For the dressing-puréed canned mandarin oranges ( didn’t have OJ concentrate ) and used lemon infused white balsamic. Delicious

I was looking for something different to make using my beets growing in my garden. This recipe is fabulous! Easy, and can be really quick if you make a little extra candied walnuts as the dressing lasted for three salads.
Made as recommended- very yummy!
Made it exactly as written and it was outstanding! Never worked with fresh beets or made candied nuts before but all went well. Thank you for sharing!

I love this salad! It was very easy to make and delicious. I really like the combination of the toasted maple syrup walnuts with the beets and the goat cheese. You only need a little of the dressing because it is strong.

This salad always goes over well at parties and potlucks. I repeatedly get asked to bring it again. For the dressing I prefer a 1:1:1 Ratio of oj concentrate/ balsamic vinegar/ oil. I always add plain cooked quinoa, it really adds to the salad. If I have time I also marinate the beets in balsamic vinegar. 
Arugula is amazing with quinoa in salads, I usually use half arugula and half mixed greens. 
I use the Candied Pecans recipe by Alix on AR for the nuts, it is the most addictive incredible recipe for candied nuts and goes well with this salad. I found the walnuts/maple syrup in this recipe too moist/ soft and missing the crunch I love in candied nuts.
When putting it together, just before serving, do it in this order for the best visual presentation:
Toss greens in dressing, put in bowl
Top with quinoa, then beets then feta then candied nuts. The white/ red contrast is beautiful, at least until it get mixed up and the whole salad becomes pink!
Really good!!
